dt.t: made the {wi}decision{/wi} to attend graduate school
Former heavyweight champion kickboxer Sterling (Cash) McCallum took a unanimous {wi}decision{/wi} over Cesar Rendon in an eight-round standard bout in Phoenix …

dt: {bc}a win or loss officially credited to a pitcher

et: Middle English {it}decisioun{/it}, from Middle French, from Latin {it}decision-, decisio{/it}, from {it}decidere{/it} to decide
shortdef: the act or process of deciding
a determination arrived at after consideration : conclusion

dt: {bc}to win by being awarded more points than (an opponent)

dt.t: … he hasn't won an important fight since he {wi}decisioned{/wi} Duran on Jan. 30, 1982.

shortdef: to win by being awarded more points than (an opponent)

dt: {bc}a branch of statistical theory concerned with quantifying the process of making choices between alternatives

shortdef: a branch of statistical theory concerned with quantifying the process of making choices between alternatives

dt: {bc}a tree diagram which is used for making decisions in business or computer programming and in which the branches represent choices with associated risks, costs, results, or probabilities

shortdef: a tree diagram which is used for making decisions in business or computer programming and in which the branches represent choices with associated risks, costs, results, or probabilities

dt: {bc}the act or process of deciding something especially with a group of people

dt.t: The project will require some difficult {it}decision-making{/it}.
All members of the organization have a role in {it}decision-making{/it}.

shortdef: the act or process of deciding something especially with a group of people —often used before another noun

dt: {bc}a decision in a boxing match reflecting a division of opinion among the referee and judges

shortdef: a decision in a boxing match reflecting a division of opinion among the referee and judges

dt: {bc}to officially decide a case by vote

dt.t: On Friday, the Supreme Court {it}handed down a decision{/it} upholding the new law.
The Court of Appeals {it}handed down a{/it} 4–2 {it}decision{/it} in favor of the new law.

shortdef: to officially decide a case by vote

dt: {bc}a decision based on facts or information

shortdef: a decision based on facts or information

dt: {bc}to disagree with a decision made earlier by a lower court

dt.t: The appeals court {it}overturned the decision{/it} made by the trial court.

shortdef: to disagree with a decision made earlier by a lower court

dt: {bc}a decision that must be made in an instant

dt.t: a {it}split-second decision{/it} to jump on the already moving train

shortdef: a decision that must be made in an instant
